title: Engagement-Learning Tradeoff
description: An interactive scatter plot MicroSim exploring the relationship between engagement features and learning effectiveness, demonstrating the diminishing returns of excessive gamification and helping designers find the optimal balance.
creator: Claude AI
subject: Instructional Design
Educational Psychology
Learning Sciences
Gamification
Engagement Theory
Multimedia Learning
audience: Educators, instructional designers, curriculum developers, and students learning about educational technology design
source: Based on research on seductive details effect (Mayer, 2009), cognitive load theory (Sweller, 1988), and game-based learning (Plass et al., 2015)
relation: Part of Automating Instructional Design intelligent textbook
coverage: Principles for balancing engagement and learning effectiveness in educational design
learningObjective: Students will evaluate the relationship between engagement features and learning effectiveness to identify optimal design approaches

features: User point visualization with trend-based learning calculation
interactivity.inputMethod: Mouse hover, mouse click, slider drag, checkbox toggle

learningObjectives: Understand the key concepts of engagement-learning tradeoff
Explore engagement-learning tradeoff through interactive visualization
Apply knowledge of engagement-learning tradeoff to solve problems
Experiment with parameters to observe their effects on engagement-learning tradeoff
